intro: Culcitium ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty culcitium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a distinctive reddish-brown coloration. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a unique ornamental effect. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
